posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Now this is another one intended to be an enjoyable build to play, rather than a spectacular one. So if you're hoping for a high CHA, casting Bard, you might want to look away now, 'cause this ain't it. This is a gruff little dwarf who happens to have the voice of an angel.

He's a party-player more than a loner (he likes an audience), and he has his favourite numbers. For Song, his standards are King of the Swingers by King Louis, What a Wonderful World by Louis Armstrong, and Reasons to be Cheerful by Ian Dury. Equally, his Curse standards are The Ace of Spades by Motorhead, Thunderstruck by AC/DC, and 21st Century Schizoid Man by King Crimson. Then he has his two floor-fillers: Oops, Upside Your Head by the Gap Band, and If I Had a Hammer (Oh, I do) by Pete Seeger, with adaptations by Klef himself.

Essentially, all he does is sing and hit things that need a good hitting. So here he is...

Howlin' Rockwolf
Fighter 4/ Bard 26/ CoT 10
Dwarf: any non-evil, non-lawful
PvM 1-40

STR 18 (34)

HPs: 376
AC: (naked) 21, (full plate) 29, (+tower shield) 32 (+4 dodge AC v giants)

Spells: UMD
Bard Song (20): 105 rounds x26p/day. +2AB, +3 damage, +3 Will, +2 Fort and Reflex, +28 HPs, +5AC, +8 skills
Skills: 224. Discipline 43 (55), Listen 21 19 (20 18), Lore 10 (34), Perform 39 (50), Spellcraft (cc) 18 38 (20 40), Tumble 40 (41), UMD 35 (33)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:
Jul 15, 2020
What is this, an epic bard with a charisma of 6???
Even King Crimson did better than that.
On the positive side, you have managed to build a melee character with 26 caster levels and no spells! 😂
Look, I'm exploring the beauty of song, here - I couldn't give a dire rat's third eye about spells! 😋🎼

And if we're going King Crimson, Robert Fripp has a charisma of considerably less than 6, so I'm being nice, believe it or not!

On a more serious note, I did want to explore the full benefits of Bard Song, as one who generally only uses the class to grab another (which is one reason I didn't opt for RDD). Admittedly, I was my normal perverse self in going for a dwarf (I did think about Half-Orc for a moment), but some of that was about the challenge of seeing whether I could still make good use of the Song while retaining pretty much all the "necessary" melee feats. Also, It irks me that Lasting Inspiration normally has to wait until well into the 30's before it's taken in many cases. Why - when it's the pinnacle of bardiness?

Your last line I take as a point of pride, btw.

Cheers

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just a thought for those who might feel a little wobbly about only 376 HPs. You could always drop Iron Will for Toughness. You still have a perfectly respectable 28 Will save, but you skip lightly over the 400 HP goal (416).

And let's not forget, he wakes with a song in his heart and on his lips, and keeps it going pretty much all day (unless he's silenced by some miserable bastard before he sings, of course. Though once he's begun, there's no stopping his warbling.)

Cheers
